content.description: Start as for the bolted line on the left side of the face, but move up and left from the first bolt, through an improbable-looking series of small edges and smears.  Reach the patina at its far left side, just to the right of the second rusty old bolt of the west prow.  Continue climbing the left edge of the patina to the bolted rap anchor. Rappel to descend.

This is a top-rope variation to the two bolted climbs of the southwest face.  It avoids the crux of either climb (with itÂ’s own crux low on thin edges and smears) as well as the easy holds, until you reach the patina.  Start on the face between the bolts, climbing straight up on very small holds.  Once the patina is reached, this climb becomes more or less the same as the climbs on either side, utilizing the same holds, as all the climbs of the southwest face come together.  A nice, fairly sustained variation to the bolted routes. Rappel to descend.

This is the bolt line on the right side of the southwest face. Climb up and around to the right of the south arete on easy holds to the second bolt. The crux comes next, a trust your feet balance move to gain the third bolt. Easy pulling through the patina gains the top of the boulder and a two-bolt anchor with rap rings. Rappel to descend.
content.protection:
4 bolts, 2 bolt anchor/rap (all 3/8") shared with

Kissed by the Sun

content.description: This is the bolt line on the left side of the southwest face.  Climb up good edges to the first bolt.  The crux is a dicey balance move to reach a sloper and the second bolt.  One more careful move and you can reach the solid edges of the patina.  Easy climbing through the patina and two more bolts allows one to reach the top of the boulder and a two-bolt anchor with rap rings.  Rappel to descend.
content.protection:
4 bolts, 2 bolt anchor/rap (all 3/8") shared with

Praise the Rays

content.description: An undercut and powerful start (crux) gives way to easier but runout climbing up plates and edges along a vague arete on the west face.
content.protection:
3 bolts (1/2" SS), use belay anchors on south face routes.

Pre-clipping the first bolt is highly recommended.
content.location: West face of the boulder, facing the trail.

content.description:
Start from a wedged block and climb a short section slab that kicks back and then steepens once more before the top.

Slightly runout in spots but the bolts are right before the hard moves.
content.location:
Located on the north side of the boulder up a textured pink slab.

Easiest approach by scrambling past the south face routes and circling around right through some brush to the base of the route.
